GPAT.gpat_q:
Followings are some drug derivatives used to increase/decrease the water solubility of the 
parent drugs:
[P] : Rolitetracycline
[Q] : Erythromycin lactobionate 
[R] : Chloramphenicol succinate 
[S] : Erythromycin stearate
Choose the correct combination of statements.
GPAT.gpat_a1: Q and R are used to increase water solubility while P and S are used to decrease it
GPAT.gpat_a2: P, Q and R are used to increase water solubility while S is used to decrease it
GPAT.gpat_a3: Q, S and R are used to increase water solubility while P is used to decrease it
GPAT.gpat_a4: Q and S are used to increase water solubility while P and Q are used to decrease it

All of the given four drugs are neuromuscular blocking agents.
[P] : Gallamine [Q]: Succinylcholine
[R] : Vecuronium [S] : d-Tubocurarine
Choose the correct statement about them.
GPAT.gpat_a1: P and Q are competitive neuromuscular blocking agents
GPAT.gpat_a2: Q and R are competitive neuromuscular blocking agents
GPAT.gpat_a3: R and S are non-competitive neuromuscular blocking agents
GPAT.gpat_a4: P and S are competitive neuromuscular blocking agents

GPAT.gpat_q: Metformin causes the following actions EXCEPT for the one. Identify that.
GPAT.gpat_a2: Increases glucose uptake in skeletal muscles

Read the following statements:
[P] : At temperature below Kraft point, micelles will, not form
[Q]: At Kraft point, solubility of surfactant equals CMC
[R] : Kraft point increases with increasing chain length of hydrocarbon
[S] : Kraft point is normally exhibited by non-ionic surfactants
Choose the correct combination of answers.
GPAT.gpat_a1: P is correct but Q, R & S are wrong
GPAT.gpat_a2: R & S are correct but P & Q are wrong
GPAT.gpat_a3: P, Q & R are correct but S is wrong
GPAT.gpat_a4: P, Q, R & S all are correct
